byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LO, the poor Indian got off, I am afraid, to a rather dubious start, so far as cultural appreciation is concerned, in the pages of Henry Wadsworth Longfellow and J. Fenimore Cooper. At least (to introduce a note of personal reminiscence) those...
docs.lead_paragraph: LO, the poor Indian got off, I am afraid, to a rather dubious start, so far as cultural appreciation is concerned, in the pages of Henry Wadsworth Longfellow and J. Fenimore Cooper. At least (to introduce a note of personal reminiscence) those writers, however earnestly well-intentioned, nipped in the bud my own childhood potentiality in the way of sympathetic response.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JAN. 25, 1941

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 26 -- The Regional Conference of the River Plate will open here tomorrow for a ten-day session, during which it is hoped to work out a program to intensify the commercial and economic relations of the countries in this part...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 26 -- The Regional Conference of the River Plate will open here tomorrow for a ten-day session, during which it is hoped to work out a program to intensify the commercial and economic relations of the countries in this part of South America in such a way as to overcome, at least partly, the serious problems that have arisen from the European war.

headline.main: LATIN TRADE UNITY IS AIM OF PARLEY; River Plate Nations to Open Talks Today on Remedies for War Problems U.S. ENVOY AN OBSERVER Leaders to Act on Demand for Practical Application of Pan-American Ideal

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITEWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 27 -- Inaugurating the Regional Conference of The River Plate this afternoon, Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguay's Foreign Minister, as president of the conference made a stirring speech in praise of democracy and expressing the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 27 -- Inaugurating the Regional Conference of The River Plate this afternoon, Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguay's Foreign Minister, as president of the conference made a stirring speech in praise of democracy and expressing the hope that this assembly would be the forerunner of similar conferences in other regions of the Americas.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 29 -- The delegates to the Regional Conference of the River Plate devoted much of their thought and activities today to insisting on the regional character of the sessions and denying reports sent abroad in the last few days...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 29 -- The delegates to the Regional Conference of the River Plate devoted much of their thought and activities today to insisting on the regional character of the sessions and denying reports sent abroad in the last few days that certain delegations were planning to inject political issues that affect nations not represented here.

docs.snippet: A reception was given yesterday afternoon at the Museum of Modern Art for the Consuls of several Latin-American countries by members of the ball committee for the Fiesta. Pan-Americana, a supper dance for the benefit of the Goddard Neighborhood...
docs.lead_paragraph: A reception was given yesterday afternoon at the Museum of Modern Art for the Consuls of several Latin-American countries by members of the ball committee for the Fiesta. Pan-Americana, a supper dance for the benefit of the Goddard Neighborhood Center, which will be held on Feb. 10 in the grand ballroom of the Waldorf-Astoria.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 30 -- Finding themselves snowed under by a volume of work they cannot possibly handle by the time originally set for adjournment, delegates to the Regional Conference of the River Plate took today off, trying to find some way out of their difficulty.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 -- The Regional Conference of the River Plate set up a new principle in inter-American economic relations today when it approved a draft convention suspending operation of the most-favored-nation clause in dealings...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 -- The Regional Conference of the River Plate set up a new principle in inter-American economic relations today when it approved a draft convention suspending operation of the most-favored-nation clause in dealings between Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay.
